article_text:
x of x Full Screen A police officer runs from a burning squad car after it was set on fire by demonstrators during a protest following the grand jury announcement Monday night in Ferguson, Mo. Brown, an 18-year-old black man, was killed by Darren Wilson, a white Ferguson police officer, on Aug. 9. The grand jury declined to indict officer Wilson. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators protest against the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown during a rally at the Department of Justice in Washington, D.C., on Monday. Jose Luis Magana/AP

x of x Full Screen Members of the St. Louis Rams raise their arms in awareness of the events in Ferguson, Mo., as they walk onto the field before a football game against the Oakland Raiders on Sunday, in St. Louis. L.G. Patterson/AP

x of x Full Screen A clergy member assists a protester as he is taken to the ground on Sunday at Kiener Plaza in St. Louis. Protesters and police clashed following an NFL football game between the St. Louis Rams and the Oakland Raiders as protests continued following a grand jury's decision not to indict a Ferguson police officer in the shooting death of Michael Brown. Laurie Skrivan/St. Louis Post-Dispatch/AP

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators hold up their hands during a protest on Tuesday in Philadelphia, the day after a grand jury's decision not to indict the police officer who fatally shot teenager Michael Brown. Matt Rourke/AP

x of x Full Screen A protester holds an upside down U.S. flag during a protest on Nov. 25 outside the White House in Washington, D.C. Mladen Antonov/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A group of protesters stands outside the Wayne Morse Free Speech Plaza on Tuesday in Eugene, Ore. Chris Pietsch/The Register-Guard/AP

x of x Full Screen A demonstrator celebrates as a business burns during rioting following the grand jury announcement in the Michael Brown case Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Cars burn at a dealership Tuesday in Dellwood, Mo. Charlie Riedel/AP

x of x Full Screen A protester confronts police after listening to the announcement of the grand jury decision Monday in Missouri. David Goldman/AP

x of x Full Screen Protesters march through the streets of New York City Monday after learning Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson would not be indicted. Andrew Burton/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Protesters in Chicago react to the grand jury decision not to indict Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson on Monday. Tasos Katopodis/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen St. Louis County prosecutor Robert McCulloch announces the grand jury's decision not to indict Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson in the Aug. 9 shooting of Michael Brown on Monday at the Buzz Westfall Justice Center in Clayton, Mo. St. Louis Post-Dispatch, Cristina Fletes-Boutte - Pool/AP

x of x Full Screen This photo released Monday shows Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson during his medical examination after he fatally shot Michael Brown, in Ferguson, Mo. Doctors diagnosed Wilson with a facial contusion (bruise), according to a medical record released as evidence to the grand jury. St. Louis County Prosecuting Attorney's Office/AP

x of x Full Screen Michael Brown Sr., father of Michael Brown, in a red hat, delivers turkeys during an annual Thanksgiving basket giveaway as he walks past a memorial for his son on Saturday in Ferguson, Mo. Joshua Lott/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A demonstrator waits outside the Ferguson police department for the grand jury's announcement Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Police guard the Ferguson police department as rioting erupts following the grand jury announcement to not indict officer Darren Wilson in the Michael Brown case on Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Police officers in Ferguson, Mo., stand guard as protesters react to the announcement of the grand jury decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson. David Goldman/AP

x of x Full Screen Protestors gather outside the White House in Washington, D.C., after the announcement that the white policeman who shot and killed an unarmed black teenager will not be indicted. Mandel Ngan/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Protesters shut down traffic by blocking the intersection of Wilshire Boulevard and Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills in reaction to the grand jury decision on Monday. David McNew/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A group of protesters vandalize a police vehicle in Ferguson, Mo., after the announcement of the grand jury decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson. David Goldman/AP

x of x Full Screen A business burns during rioting Monday in Dellwood, Mo. Aaron P. Bernstein/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Smoke fills a laundromat as a strip mall burns during protests Tuesday in Ferguson, Mo. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A looter walks out of a burning Walgreens store following the grand jury announcement in the Michael Brown case Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Firemen extinguish a burning business during rioting Monday in Dellwood, Mo. Aaron P. Bernstein/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Protesters shut down I-44 at Grand Avenue in both directions in St. Louis Monday. J.B. Forbes/St. Louis Post-Dispatch/AP

x of x Full Screen Smoke from a burning building drifts by police officers Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A sign rests in the rubble of a strip mall set on fire after the grand jury announcement in the Michael Brown case Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A car drives by a burning building Monday in Ferguson, Mo. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Lesley McSpadden, the mother of Michael Brown, left, stands on the top of a car Monday in Ferguson, Mo., as she listens to the announcement of the grand jury decision not to indict officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of her son. Charlie Riedel/AP

x of x Full Screen Police officers stand guard in front of the Ferguson Police Department as protesters react to the announcement of the grand jury decision Monday. Charlie Riedel/AP

x of x Full Screen Police officers secure an area in front of the Buzz Westfall Justice Center on Monday in Clayton, Mo., where a grand jury has been considering whether to indict white Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson for shooting and killing an 18-year-old black teenager, Michael Brown. Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon declared a state of emergency Monday and activated the National Guard ahead of the decision. Many fear an outbreak of violence if the jury fails to indict Wilson. Jewel Samad/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators shout slogans during a march in St. Louis on Sunday to protest Brown's death. Jewel Samad/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Protesters block traffic as they march in St. Louis Sunday. Jeff Roberson/AP

x of x Full Screen Matt Pearce, a reporter with the Los Angeles Times, holds his head after getting hit by a rock thrown into the crowd during a protest in the streets of St. Louis Sunday. David Goldman/AP

x of x Full Screen An angry crowd protests in front of the Ferguson police station on Saturday in Ferguson, Mo. Charlie Riedel/AP

x of x Full Screen More than 100 protesters participated in the march in St. Louis Sunday. Jewel Samad/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A pedestrian passes through barricades lining the exterior of the Buzz Westfall Justice Center on Sunday. David Goldman/AP

x of x Full Screen Media satellite trucks convene outside the Buzz Westfall Justice Center on Monday. Michael B.Thomas/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Ray Mills, left, and Londrelle Hall view the Michael Brown memorial on Sunday in Ferguson, Mo. Mills and Hall spent nearly three weeks running from Atlanta to draw attention to Brown's death. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators block an intersection on Sunday in St. Louis. Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Police officers and demonstrators clash during a protest Thursday night outside the Ferguson police station in Ferguson, Mo. Michael B. Thomas/AFP/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators have gathered at the Ferguson police station all week. Pictured, a protester in a gas mask stares at an officer in riot gear outside the building Wednesday night. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A protester raises his hands on Florissant Road outside the police station Wednesday. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Shonta Johnson, of Chicago, takes photos of the memorial for Michael Brown on Monday, located in the street where he was shot. Charlie Riedel/AP

x of x Full Screen Plywood covers the glass front of a strip mall along West Florissant Avenue on Wednesday night in the Ferguson area. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Flannery Miller and Michael Skolnik, of New York City, help install posters on boarded-up business fronts Wednesday on West Florissant Avenue. The posters were made by St. Louis artist Damon Davis as part of the Push Forward Project. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen A demonstrator holds a sign reading "Killer Cops Enter Here" next to the Ferguson police station Monday. Joe Raedle/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Police confront demonstrators outside the police station in Ferguson on Thursday. At least three people were arrested during the protest. Scott Olson/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Demonstrators lay on the ground Sunday in St. Louis in a protest of Michael Brown's shooting death. Joe Raedle/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Hundreds of demonstrators laid on the ground during the "die-in" protest Sunday in St. Louis. Joe Raedle/Getty Images

x of x Full Screen Police form a line in front of the protesters outside the Ferguson police station Thursday. Scott Olson/Getty Images
